author: grapebaba
content: For the integration portal in geth, I think there needs to be a consensus on this discv5 issue https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/30581. <@194432762315407360> <@240180844130598912> <@510413979080720385> <@403636673914863626> for current nim and rust impls, i think we need change the spec.

author: kolbyml
content: <@822475622956662814> well I would make a PR to update the discv5 spec to match the behavior `nim-eth/eth/p2p/discoveryv5` and `sigp/discv5` uses

author: kolbyml
content:
`2025-01-28T23:09:01.118025Z  WARN discv5::socket::send: Sending packet larger than max size size=8325 max=1280` there appears to be a bug somewhere in Trin I need to fix, I wonder why we are sending packets of size 8k.

I mention this as Portal's use case with discv5 is unique in that we demand much higher throughput then EL/CL's need for node discovery. So I am using this as an excuse to say [discv5: sub-protocol data transmission](<https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/issues/229>), would be cool to have, expessially as EL's want faster data transmissions from Portal
